result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio M Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Mark Jay Gumz appeared by phone means for Defendant Antonio M Hernandez. Prosecuting Atty  Chad A Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Antonio M Hernandez not in court.
Atty Gumz states his client contacted him from DOC; has a release date of 2035.  Atty Gumz asks the court to quash the warrant.  State takes no position.

BY THE COURT:  Court will deny the request; commitment will stand.
to Court from Atty Gumz regarding commitment for unpaid financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Telephone conference on September 20, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

(No Notice mailed to Antonio Hernandez - KMK)
Telephone conference on August 15, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the DOC had written the court for clarification of sentence credit.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant was recently sentenced in Milwaukee County for a Prison sentence. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will set for internal review in 30 days.  Inactive Account Review scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Telephone conference on March 22, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
to Court from DOC regarding Amended Rev Order and Warrant
Telephone conference on March 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Antonio M Hernandez in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet and prepared to proceed.  Court questions the defense.  Atty Gumz received a copy of the revocation packet and has reviewed that with his client.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 1 year Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
*Credit = 590 days
*Restitution = be converted to a Civil Judgment
*Comply with all rules of supervision
*Make a good faith effort to pay child support outstanding
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

Atty Gumz asks that if the defendant is revoked; the remainder of the credit be used.
Atty Hendee responds and asks if that matter comes up then a hearing be set.
BY THE COURT:  If ES is revoked; their might be credit towards that but at that time, the court will decide then.

w/attachments
restitution supplement

Defendant Antonio M Hernandez in court with attorney Timothy C Henney.  Defendant Antonio M Hernandez in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1.  Cts 2-3 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Henney states his client will waive his right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant as to his waiver.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and understandingly waived his right to the preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings. 
State files Information.  Atty Henney received the Information and waives it's reading.  
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1.  Cts 2-3 are dismissed and read-in.
PSI is not requested by either party.  Counsel make sentencing arguments.  Victim makes statement.  
BY THE COURT:
Ct 1:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 36 months with the following conditions:
*Pay costs of $268.00.  *Restitution to be determined.  (State has 30 days to file that amount)  *Counseling as recommended by the agent.  *Maintain full-time employment or complete work searches as recommended by Marquette County Child Support Agency.  *Keep current with child support & arrears payments.  *Granted 35 days credit for time served if probation is revoked.  *Defendant sentenced to 30 days jail, stayed at this time.  Agent may request all or a portion of that sentence be lifted if defendant does not comply with conditions of probation.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Antonio M Hernandez in court with attorney Margaret A. Waterman.  Defendant Antonio M Hernandez in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Waterman states that the defendant will waive time limits and asks for a pre-trial.

BY THE COURT:  Time Limits waived for the Prelim.
Set for Prelim.


Atty Waterman asks that bond be reduced to a signature bond due to the defendant will lose his job if he does not report to work tonight.
Atty Hendee objects to the bond modification.
BY THE COURT:  Bond motion denied.  Bond will remain the same.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on March 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
*Maintain current child support obligations outstanding.
